title: Step Tracker
shortDesc: Complete design for a step tracker using ADXL335 accelerometer, encompassing mechanical, electrical, hardware, and programming knowledge.
fullDesc:
A wearable step-counting device developed using Arduino and motion sensors to track walking activity. Features an LCD display for real-time metrics accessible buttons for control. Designed through iterative prototyping with custom PCB design, 3D modelling and printing as well as C++ programming. 
 Skills: C++, hardware prototyping, PCB design, sensor integration, CAD, 3D Printing.

title: Steering Control System
shortDesc: ROS Interfacing/Programming, controlling various platforms and programming behaviours for autonomous LIDAR navigation and mapping.
fullDesc:
Practical Foundations of Mobile Systems assignment involving autonomous robot navigation. Implemented path planning algorithms, sensor fusion, and real-time control systems. Focus on practical robotics principles and hands-on hardware integration. 
 Skills: ROS, Gazebo, C++, control systems.

title: Robotic Guide Dog SLAM
fullDesc:
Implemented SLAM (Simultaneous Localisation and Mapping) for autonomous robot navigation. Integrated multiple sensors including LIDAR and RGBD Cameras, developed feature detection algorithms, and created real-time mapping visualisation. Implemented obstacle avoidance, path planning, and sensor-based decision making. Tested reliability and adaptability of the navigation stack. 
 Skills: ROS, C++, SLAM algorithms, sensor integration.

title: Fetch Robot Vision
shortDesc: Computer vision system for object detection and tracking.
fullDesc: Developed computer vision systems using ArUco markers and object detection algorithms for autonomous robot following/operation. Implemented real-time image processing pipeline, sensor calibration, and integration with robotic control systems. Skills: OpenCV, Python, C++, ROS.

title: Collaborative Robots
shortDesc: Controlling UR3 cobots for industrial applications.
fullDesc:
Utilised industrial robotics techniques to program and control UR3 collaborative robots for various tasks. Developed motion planning, end-effector control, and safety protocols for human-robot interaction. Applied transforms, forward kinematics, inverse kinematics, poses and orientations, joint space and cartesian space trajectories, and point cloud generations. Utilised Peter Corke's Robotics Toolbox for MATLAB. 
 Skills: MATLAB, industrial robotics/kinematics, end effector control, programming, simulation setup and control.

title: WARMAN Challenge Robot
shortDesc: Warman Challenge and First Mechanical Design Robot, focus on CAD modelling and solving for a project brief.
fullDesc:
Designed and built a competition robot for the WARMAN Challenge, emphasising mechanical engineering principles and CAD modelling. Developed comprehensive 3D models to meet specific project requirements and constraints. Focused on iterative design, structural optimisation, and practical problem-solving. Integrated mechanical systems and validated designs through testing and prototyping. 
 Skills: CAD modelling, mechanical design, 3D printing, prototyping, design optimisation.

title: FPGA Demo
shortDesc: Digital logic implementation on FPGA hardware.
fullDesc:
Implemented digital circuits and algorithms on FPGA hardware. Gained hands-on experience with hardware description languages and architecture, real-time processing, and embedded system design. Explored parallel processing capabilities. 
 Skills: FPGA architecture, digital design, Embedded C programming, waveform logic analysis.

title: Robot Royale
shortDesc: UNSW Robot Royale Competition, programming and controlling a 150g antweight robot in an arena
fullDesc:
Participated in the plastic division with a 150g antweight robot. My team and I designed, 3D-printed, and soldered modular robot components (including weapon and drive systems) then iteratively tested and refined them under load testing. Competing head-to-head in real battles and making it to the semi-finals. 
 Skills: Mechanical design, electronics, soldering, programming.

title: Flight Simulator (currently in progress)
shortDesc: Designing a FLight SImulator control rig with UTS AeroSpace Society
fullDesc:
Designing and building a flight simulator control rig for UTS AeroSpace Society. The rig will include realistic controls such as yoke, throttle, and pedals, integrated with flight simulation software. Focus on mechanical design, electronics integration, and user experience to create an immersive simulation environment. 
 Skills: Mechanical design, electronics integration, user experience design.
